turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about On Ancient Medicine.
turn.1: Where did the Western medical thought originate?
turn.2: There were two seminal schools of Western medical thought; there was Agrigentum on the southern coast of Sicily and Croton on the west coast of the Gulf of Taranto.
turn.3: What was the difference between the two cities?
turn.4: Agrigentum was the home of Empedocles, while Croton harbored the Pythagorean sect of medical philosophy.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The school of Agrigentum and Empedocles placed great emphasis on cure by contraries and thus should be associated with Group III of the Hippocratic Corpus.
turn.7: Which group was associated with Group II?
turn.8: The school of Croton rejected the notion of cure by contraries while championing the medical philosophy that perceived the human organism consists of an infinite number of humors.
turn.10: The arguments of this group should be identified with Group IV of the Hippocratic Corpus.
turn.11: Who was the leader of Croton?
turn.12: The first medical philosopher of the school of Croton was Alcmaeon of Croton.
